text: Archibald Lindsay was a Scottish professional football left back who played in the Football League for Fulham. He also played in the Scottish League for St Johnstone, Dundee and Lochgelly United. == Personal life == Lindsay served as a private in the Black Watch during the First World War. == Honours == St Johnstone *Consolation Cup: 1913–14 == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |National Cup ! colspan="2" |Other ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- | rowspan="3" |Dundee |1910–11 | rowspan="2" |Scottish First Division |9 |1 |4 |0 | colspan="2" |― |13 |1 |- |1911–12 |23 |0 | colspan="2" |― | colspan="2" |― |23 |0 |- ! colspan="2" |Total !32 !1 !4 !0 ! colspan="2" |― !36 !1 |- |Third Lanark |1911–12 |Scottish First Division |0 |0 |1 |0 | colspan="2" |― |1 |0 |- | rowspan="3" |St Johnstone |1912–13 | rowspan="2" |Scottish Second Division |24 |1 |6 |0 | colspan="2" |― |30 |1 |- |1913–14 |21 |0 | colspan="2" |― |8Appearances in Scottish Qualifying Cup |0 |29 |0 |- ! colspan="2" |Total !45 !1 !6 !0 !8 !0 !59 !1 |- |Lochgelly United |1914–15 |Scottish Second Division |9 |0 | colspan="2" |― |8 |0 |17 |0 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !86 !2 !11 !0 !16 !0 !113 !2 |} ==References== Category:Scottish footballers Category:English Football League players Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:Southern Football League players Category:1882 births Category:Year of death missing Category:People from Rosneath Category:Association football fullbacks Category:Black Watch soldiers Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Rutherglen Glencairn F.C. players Category:Renton F.C. players Category:Reading F.C. players Category:Fulham F.C. players Category:Dundee F.C. players Category:Third Lanark A.C. players Category:St Johnstone F.C. players Category:Lochgelly United F.C. players Category:Sportspeople from Argyll and Bute
